p: Analysis by GC-MS identified 91.17%, 90.54% and 91.99% of the present chemical constituents in oils of C. aurantifolia, A. nobile and L. officinalis, respectively. A wide variety of compounds were found in each oil; however, the major constituents were limonene (56.37%), β-pinene (11.86%) and γ-terpinene (11.42%) in C. aurantifolia oil; isobutyl angelate (29.26%), isoamyl angelate (15.27%) and α-thujene (8.92%) in A. nobile oil, and linalool acetate (35.97%), trans-sabinene hydrate (29.17%) and camphor (5.54%) in L. officinalis oil (Table 1).
